jogo mais bugado e mal feito que já joguei sem a menor sombra de dúvida. a behaviour caga mole pro jogo pra comunidade, cada patch com 1 bugfix introduz mais 5 bugs que nao tem absolutamente nenhuma relação com nada mexido no patch, todos as dlcs vem com incontáveis bugs, infestado até a boca de hacker e, desde o patch do skill based matchmaking (que também não funciona), o jogo ativamente te pune por não rushar gens e querer entrar em chases.

não vou nem entrar no mérito da progressão do jogo. é um jogo que custa mais de 300 reais com todas as dlcs e nem 500h de jogo te conseguem todas as perks. uma pena que um jogo com uma proposta tão boa tenha sido completamente destruído pela pior empresa que já gerenciou um jogo online.

ホラー映画やスプラッター映画が好きでこのゲームに辿り着いたのなら、このゲームをプレイするべきではない。

昔は、生存者としてプレイすれば強靭な殺人鬼に追われ、恐怖するというホラー映画の登場人物にしかできなかったはず体験ができ、
殺人鬼としてプレイすれば逃げ惑う生存者を追い回し、無残に殺すというスプラッター映画の登場人物にしかできなかったはずの体験ができる良いゲームでした。

今や生存者は4人で通話をしながら片手間にプレイし、殺人鬼側が下手だとわかるとわざと目の前に躍り出て煽り散らし、
殺人鬼を続けているような人々は動画投稿者か配信者がほとんどで、視聴者の期待を裏切れない責任感から続けざる負えず、プレッシャーにさらされながらプレイしているのがほとんどのように思える。

このゲームはかなり名が売れた。しかしそれがゲームの楽しまれ方を大きく変えてしまったのだと思う。

ルインが弱体化されても、ヒルビリーが弱体化されても、その間にどれだけ生存者側が優遇されてきても殺人鬼を続けてきた。

でももうダメです。今回ばかりは耐えられない。全ての殺人鬼が完璧に試合をこなせるわけじゃない以上、殺人鬼の弱体化にも、生存者の強化にも限度があったはずだ。
生存者として雰囲気を楽しもうにも、今の環境では昔のような恐怖を感じることはできない。希望の灯にも感じていたはずの発電機の発電通知は、通電のブザーと併せてもはや当たり前のものとなってしまった。
殺人鬼をしている方がまだハラハラする。

全ての殺人鬼が、スクリーンの中のあの殺人鬼たちのように強靭で恐ろしい存在になることはもはや不可能なのだろう。
少なくとも運営はそのような未来を描いてはいなさそうだ。

さようなら強大で恐ろしかった殺人鬼達。
さようならみすぼらしい犠牲者であってくれた生存者達。

Game has gone down the shitter not going to lie. New MMR system doesnt not work like a true MMR system so you get pitted against either really easy killers or terrifyingly hard to play against, sweaty try-hard killers. If you die you get put against easy killers if you escape you get tryhard killers. Survivors that only hold M1 and do generators and hide in bushes rather than distract the killers are seen as the "best players" of the dead by daylight community. They also used their HellRaiser chapter, a killer who made an impact in the world of horror, as a way to support NFT without telling those purchasing the chapter, and not telling even the game dev's that they were workinjg for producing NFT's which are harmful to the environment. The individual they are working with is also known to be anti-LGBTQ and a conspiracy theorist. I can't support this company any longer with how they are now running their game and I have 544 hours in it and been around since the Alpha.

Corporate BHVR makes terrible decisions. I'm sure the average employee doesn't agree with their decisions. This game is slowly but surely dying. Constant backlash from the fanbase and top content creators that know more about the game than anyone that makes these changes. Bugs, unbalanced gameplay, and recently their choice to start selling NFTs is killing your game, BHVR. If you don't want your potential masterpiece to be forgotten, take time away from adding characters/cosmetics and fix your game. 

tl;dr don't buy, filled with a growing amount of flaws

Dead by Daylight is a good game, that is best enjoyed with friends. The matchmaking needs a little more work, because when you play as a killer or at least from what I have seen, you can get matched up against people that are 3 to 4 ranks above you and the match becomes unenjoyable. The same thing can be said when you are a survivor and get matched against a killer that is at a way higher rank as you. But even then when you play with friends, either queing together or doing custom games, then the game can becomes quite enjoyable.
操你妈的死马没脚印图腾

This game can be incredibly fun if you dont take rank serious.

I say this, because playing for rank can be fun and it always will be, but for me personally achieving rank 1 once was enough. The problem is, that there is no real reward to gain by having a high rank except for some bloodpoints and the achievement you once get. I personally enjoy playing with my friends and "for" my friends way more, meaning that i dont care if i derank or not, but i only want to get them out and have some fun moments (flash light saves and so on). Sometimes taking a break from dead by daylight (maybe just  a few weeks or days) really helps me have fun again, because i dont get into the dull daily routine of just spamming some games with no real meaning.

Overall it is a great experience playing this game unless you only care about your own escape. 
Can make some great friends at that <3

Horrible, buggy game made by greedy and idiotic devs. Only fun in certain niche ways, otherwise do not buy. It had a chance to be good, but all of the devs who had some intelligence left the team. The lead dev is a braindead incel who runs crutch perks and makes decisions based on his own lack of skill. Most of the updates are either to provide crutches for the braindead devs or for greed. They keep adding updates despite bugs that are almost gamebreaking that have been in the game for YEARS, and they fix any balance issues by adding more perks which only make the problem worse in the long term. This game can be fun with friends but it gets old quick.

The game has a lot of balancing issues and every update comes with countless bugs and barely any fixes. On top of that, with the recent news of the NFTs, it's now obvious that the developer only truly cares about the money that lines their pocket instead of making a functioning game. I don't recommend this game, it genuinely does nothing good for itself or its players

Dead by Daylight is an incredible concept wrapped in terrible systems, toxic community, and a dev team that likes to pretend to listen to their community when they are doing the opposite. This game does not respect your time, requiring many hours of grinding just to have a singular competitive character. If you want to play the other side (Survivor or Killer) then get ready to start that grind again. If you want to play a *different* killer, another grind. The community has created a "rulebook" that you must follow or you get toxicity, occasionally following you out of game. 

The 4v1 concept is a good one, I just hope some of the up-and-coming competitors are successful.

Hated the game for a while but it's gotten significantly better lately with updates reworking basically everything meta and not breaking the game in the process. Honestly a pretty good time with friends (never play survivor solo) or if you can deal with the stress of a 4V1 then killer is great.

Update: There were ups and downs, but recent chapter, as well as planned perk overhaul are a solid improvement to both gameplay and balance and finally delivered changes community asked for (with few minor questionable decisions). Still, it would be unfair to keep my previous review. Release was more stable and new content was actually balanced and enjoyable. Looks like a decent step towards better experience. 

----
I've waited some time before sharing this opinion. I didn't want it to be skewed by first impressions or unfortunate accidents. Sadly it appears "unfortunate accidents" are just new chapters.

Anyway, this is probably the best asymmetrical horror game available as for now, since no other game survived and VHS is still in closed alpha. It can be enjoyable and interesting at times. You can play it for few hours and be happy and entertained in the end. It's possible. What's wrong then?

1. Balance and first steps. 
This genre proves to be difficult to balance. For new players being a survivor is usually very difficult and they might be convinced that this game extremely favors killers, but as they progress they notice it's not true. Still, the entry skill level might be discouraging for some people. There is no COOP vs AI mode, so as soon as you finish tutorial, you are on your own and you must play PVP games, which are usually not the best place for first steps. You can play custom games with friends, assuming you have at least 4 of them. Balance itself is heavily changed by perks - band aids introduced to counter certain playstyles and behaviors which stem from faulty design. 

2. Perks and progress. 
Each killer and survivor comes with 3 unique perks - passive or active abilities that enhance or change gameplay in some way, or force opponent to adopt certain strategies. You can't see your opponents' perks before and during the match, so you can't adapt your build before the game starts. Each perk has 3 tiers, increasing their efficiency. Perks can be leveled by spending bloodpoints (a currency gained from pvp matches) in the blood web - character's progression tree. Blood web is one of the most malicious grind systems I've ever seen. There is a limited amount of nodes on each level of it. You need to unlock nodes in order to progress to next level. Nodes are perks and consumables available for given character. All of them appear randomly, so you can't control what you get. This means that if you are unlucky, you need to spend a lot of points to get the perks you need to tier 3. Each perk can be unlocked as a teachable - available in the pool of perks randomly selected to be available in a blood web. This means If you have a killer with a nice perk unlocked at level 40, you need to level this killer to 40, and level all killers you want this perk on until you are lucky enough to get it. There is a blood point cap - limit on blood points you can keep at the same time, which means you can't prepare for leveling another character. There are workarounds like not redeeming daily rewards or challenges, but that just shouldn't take place.

3. New content.
Roughly every few months a new chapter is released. New content is created quite often compared to other games, but the problem with it makes everything above completely irrelevant. Game is in a horrible state after each chapter. There are crashes, game breaking bugs, issues that can make you lose your game or disconnect you and reward with DC penalty for matchmaking. Your game becomes unusable for quite some time, and the worst thing about it is that those issues were already known on PTB, and absolutely nothing was done about them. PTB serves only to show new cosmetics, bugs and issues go live. At first I thought it was just a single unlucky chapter, blunders like that happen even to the best, but it's the same pattern each time. Sometimes problematic maps get disabled and then weeks go by until they return, there is a kill switch introduced, which allows to disable problematic content without a patch, but I doubt it will help much, because it's not just specific content, it's tons of seemingly unrelated details that stop working, preventing killers from using their powers, survivors from getting unhooked, allowing stuns through the walls, crashing game and so on.  There's also a recurring problem with broken facial rigs, so your favourite survivor might get turned into gremlin for few patches. There must always be one. 

4. Communication with devs.
There were issues that took years to be acknowledged and fixed, communication is poor at best. Surveys are being conducted quite often, but it's just normal that devs either ignore issues brought up by a huge part of playerbase, or introduce something no one asked for. 

5. NFT controversy.
With Hellraiser chapter an NFT controversy emerged - developers cooperated with a company responsible for non-fungible tokens. They were supposed to be a proof of ownership of Cenobite models and voicelines. It was also suspected that unique in-game content would be available for token buyers, but it wasn't confirmed. Apart from being ridiculousy expensive, a lot of energy is consumed to create them, so it's like a receipt produced by a Soviet steel mill. Not very environment friendly to say the least. Fact that it is supported wasn't received warmly by the community, and the issue is still there to be addressed. 

To sum everything up, balance is questionable, game feels unfair pretty often, progress system is outdated and not player friendly, game needs operation health, but new, untested content is pushed instead, issues are barely addressed, communication on the line devs-community is poor and now there is some shady stuff emerging as if we didn't have enough.

Disclaimer: Despite that, I hope I will be able to change my mind about this game. It has a great potential, but I can't recommend it in its current state.

Update: It's getting worse with every patch. Fair playstyles are getting harder and harder to pull off and mean strategies are the easiest way to get results. Survivor queue times are considerably longer than they used to be, which is just strange, since for balanced queue times only 1-4 killer survivor ratio is needed. This means active killers are way less than 25% of playerbase. I'm genuinely surprised it could go that bad in a matter of few months.

有名なゲームですから、基本的なルールは実況者様方の動画を見ればある程度つかめると思うので割愛します。
また、私はキラー陣営のみプレイしているためサバイバー側から見た全体的な難易度等は分からないので、キラー視点でのレビューのみ書かせていただきます。

結論から言えば、良ゲーではあるものの、運営のサバイバー優遇のひどいゲームです。
発電機は開始から１分しないうちに最低でも１台は修理が完了し、強いキラーやパークが出たと思えば即座にナーフを食らい、初心者がキラーをやろうとすれば勝手がつかめるまでは最悪誰も傷つけられず試合が終わるでしょう。
これは運営側とプレイヤー側で『勝利』の定義がズレているせいもあると思います。運営はいわゆる「２サク２逃げ」、サバイバーを二人殺害すれば勝ちと言っていますが、プレイヤー側からすればそんなもの勝ちではありません。４人全員殺してようやく気持ちのいい勝利と言えるでしょう。
また、キラーはなぜかランクを上げるために慈悲を与えなくてはいけません。一度も救助させずに勝利すれば査定ももらえるＢＰもひどいものです。
さらに現在の発電機爆速環境では遅延パークが必須。というか今の環境的に使えるパークはほぼ決まっており遊びがありません。勝ちたいならテンプレをそろえろと言わんばかり。
おそらく運営は現環境でキラーを遊んだことがないのでしょう。遊んでいるなら相当の腕前、あるいは相当のマゾです。
他にもいろいろ言いたいことはありますが長くなりすぎるので割愛します。純粋にゲームを楽しみながら勝ちたい人はサバイバーをプレイするのをお勧めしますね。

This game can be a lot of fun in the first few hours, even more fun with friends, but when you start to see the disgusting and repetitive usage of perks and items(meta), this game start to slowly fade away from fun to torture, even more if you are playing with Killer.

We basically have a really fun game with really, reaaaally bad balancing, devs are pratically blind with their own game besides their memes and DLC/cosmetic shop, even some of their cosmetics are bugged/bad(I'm lookin at you Grandma Jill taking months to fix it and last patch bugged her face again AND cosmetics so bright that people refuse to use because killer can see you from far away, this applies to killer cosmetics too), you can't equip more than 3 pieces of cosmetics because BHVR won't update this system since they still earn $$ from playerbase. 

Each update BHVR keep bringing old bugs back, game breaking bugs like unreachable totem in some maps(there's even reachable totem's out there but when you start cleasing it you'll get kicked from the animation because you are stuck in a invisible wall or box), devs don't know their own game.

DBD had/has a lot of potential but BHVR are digging their own grave within these 5 years of same meta perks, old/new bugs, bad at balancing perks/killers and maps(indoors maps are a real pain for a lot of the killers), devs DON'T KNOW HOW THEIR OWN MMR SYSTEM WORKS and yes there is an MMR system. 

If you want some proof of all of this I wrote, check their last Q&A and look how blind and delusional they are with their own community, game and system, this is the last Q&A they did as I wrote this review: https://www.youtube.com/watchv=Pz7f_WPutq8

I'll edit this review if I remember more stuff like hacks growing exponentially since 2020, people usually don't see it since some of them only make survivors run 5-10% faster, they hack in a way casual players won't see and know they are using it or reports doing nothing against toxicity since there is like mini ban waves from BHVR staff each year.

Here is the most impactful one if you are f2p, garbage RNG perk system they refuse to update, so now you have 1 million perks and if you don't put perks like We're gonna live 
forever(survivor) or BBC & Chilli(Killer) to farm bloodpoints you will have a really bad time.

Do you want any perk from movie DLC character and not pay for it? Good luck in Shrine of Secrets rotating 4 perks(2 for survivor and 2 killer) each week, paying 2k for each perk with the only in-game currency(take ages to get 2k if you compare with bloodpoints)that you can buy skins  without $ and getting lucky or just pay $$ for the DLC and torture yourself farming bloodpoints so you can spend them in that bloated RNG perk system.
*this review has been sold as an NFT and is no longer available!*

Before I start, I'll preface this by saying I like playing Killer. I also had a bit of experience through watching Youtube videos, which whenever you purchase a game, I would suggest watching before you do (unless the game is story based, of course.) While I'm not clueless on survivor and I can loop fairly well, the meat of my experience comes from killer, so take that as you will.

Game has a curve to it. The better you get, the worse it becomes. I played games at the beginning as killer, then as the game continued, I felt pressured to spend money to unlock perks that would allow me to even compete against higher ranked survivors. This is a vital point that you need to consider before entering this game: how much money are you willing to spend? While you can still technically play the game without spending money, leveling up gives you points, known as shards, you can spend on non-licensed killers or random perks available for purchase every week, there are a certain number of perks that are almost required.

Look, let's be realistic here. We aren't all epic gamers that dominate the competition without a sweat, if you're lacking meta perks, you're gonna struggle at higher end play. And even if you don't, you usually have to employ a tactic that generally ruins the fun of the other players in your match. I don't personally like doing that, so I suffer for it. The basic point here is the game is semi-P2W. If you count licensed characters into the deal, you're spending a good chunk of change to experience the full package here. This game loves it's DLC.

Speaking of perks, let me actually explain the leveling system, since that's a fairly important part of this game. Every match, for doing specific things, you will obtain bloodpoints. Bloodpoints can be spent buying random stuff for your character from their specific bloodweb, which is a web of addons and offerings that you can use once per game usually. (there are exceptions). Once you complete a bloodweb, you'll level up that character. Every character can level up to level 50, then the bloodweb becomes infinite. Every character has three perks allotted to them, that you can use along with simple perks that every character has, but when a character reaches levels 35, 40, and 45, you unlock those perks for all characters, that you can then randomly buy in their bloodwebs whenever the game feels like letting you buy them.

As I said earlier, the game gets harder as your overall level increases. You're going to start seeing the same perks, over and over again, and your games are going to go from a jolly stabbing spree to a game of micromanagement, as every second counts towards your inevitable doom as the survivors get ever closer to escaping you. There is something... fascinating about how the game goes from being low level survivors fearing you as they run about like chickens with their heads chopped off, to a bunch of guys teabagging the serial killer as they utilize pieces of wood and flashlights to make him regret his psychopathic tendencies. Don't be deceived into thinking this is a horror game, it's an action game with a horror paint job.

For the base price of the game, you're going to at least get your moneys worth, the game at a fundamental level is entertaining, but if your looking at this game as something to put serious time into, I would look elsewhere. The developers legitimately make me sad watching what they've decided to do to their game, with their shoddy handling of the Stranger Things DLC (after November 17th, you can no longer buy any Stranger Things DLC; seriously though, how the fuck do you lose the rights to paid DLC, is this a joke?) as well as the more recent news that Dead by Daylight is participating in the destructive practices of NFTs (an entire story on it's own.) makes me fear for the games future.

The game has ups and downs, and I would say the time it gave me has been mostly fun, thus the playtime, I just wish it was able to keep up the momentum.
